topic.title: HP Helion OpenStack(R) Carrier Grade (Beta): Creating Tenants and Updating Quotas Using the CLI

body.p: You can use the CLI to create and configure tenants.
Note: This feature applies only to servers in the VNF Region.
This exercise creates the tenants tenant1 and tenant2, and sets up their resource quotas.

ol.li: Log in to the active controller as the Keystone admin user.$ source /etc/nova/openrc
Create a project (or, tenant) tenant1.keystone tenant-create --name tenant1
Create a project (or, tenant) tenant2.keystone tenant-create --name tenant2

Set up the UUID variables for the new tenants.export tenant1_UUID=`keystone tenant-list | grep tenant1 | \ awk '{print $2}'`
export tenant2_UUID=`keystone tenant-list | grep tenant2 | \ awk '{print $2}'`

Adjust VM quotas for the tenants.{tenant1_UUID} --instances 20 -- cores 40 \ --floating_ips 20
nova quota-update ${tenant2_UUID} --instances 20 -- cores 40 \ --floating_ips 20

Adjust networking resource quotas for the tenant admin.neutron quota-update --subnet 32 --tenant-id {admin_tenant_UUID}
The two additional tenants are available now, with quotas established.
